natural problem: Simplify $$(x^3+4x^2-7x+11)+(-4x^4-x^3+x^2+7x+3).$$  Express your answer as a polynomial with the terms in order by decreasing degree.
natural solution: We rearrange the sum to make it easier to collect like terms: \begin{align} &(x^3+4x^2-7x+11)+(-4x^4-x^3+x^2+7x+3)\\ &\qquad=-4x^4+(1-1)x^3+(1+4)x^2+(-7+7)x+(11+3)\\ &\qquad=\boxed{-4x^4+5x^2+14}. \end{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = x powr 3 + 4 * x powr 2 - 7 * x + 11"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = -4 * x powr 4 - x powr 3 + x powr 2 + 7 * x + 3"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x + Q x"
shows  "R x = -4 * x powr 4 + 5 * x powr 2 + 14"
